meanings.sent1: The execs of the company held a meeting to discuss the new project.
meanings.sent2: The execs made important decisions about the future of the business.
meanings.sent3: The execs joked about having a race to see who could reach the top floor first.
meanings.sent4: The execs were the captains of the ship, guiding it through stormy waters.
meanings.sent5: The execs were like the chess pieces moving strategically on the board of business.

meanings.definition: Execs: Plural form of exec, short for executive.
meanings.sent1: She admired the execs for their sharp business acumen.
meanings.sent2: The execs were seen as the leaders of the industry.
meanings.sent3: The execs decided to have a friendly competition to boost morale.
meanings.sent4: The execs were the stars of the corporate world, shining brightly in their roles.
meanings.sent5: The execs were the engines driving the company forward with their vision and expertise.

meanings.definition: Execs: Third person singular form of exec, meaning to carry out or accomplish something.
meanings.sent1: He execs his tasks diligently to ensure they are completed on time.
meanings.sent2: She execs her responsibilities with precision and care.
meanings.sent3: The team execs the plan flawlessly, impressing everyone with their efficiency.
meanings.sent4: The student execs the experiment, achieving outstanding results.
meanings.sent5: The chef execs the recipe, creating a masterpiece that delights the taste buds.
